info.title: Audit API
info.description:
### Current version: 4

https://api.serpstat.com/v4 â€” Endpoint URL, through which all requests should be processed.

### API protocol

- Our API protocol is [**JSON-RPC 2.0**](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification).

### Requests

- All requests should be sent via **POST** method.
- All request parameters must be set via POST request body in **JSON** format.
- Each request should contain a `method` name parameter corresponding to the API method (case-sensitive).

### Authentication

- Tokens are used for authentication. Create a token on [your profile page](https://serpstat.com/users/profile/). 
- `token` is required for all API requests.
- Api token is available for almost paid and trial plans that have API feature enabled.

### Pagination

For pagination, use the parameters:
- `size`: number of results per page (default 100, maximum 1000);
- `page`: page number (default is 1st page).

Please note: not all methods are supporting pagination.


### Filters

Filters can be applied to each method, most of them are specific for the method you used.
`filters` object are optional for most methods.

### Responses

- All responses are in **JSON** format.
- All responses have 200 HTTP status, even erroneous ones. In case of error, the response contains an `error` object instead of `result`.


### API credits (limits)

When calculating the used credits, your pricing plan's API requests are taken into account, including identical requests and requests for export.

### Request rates

Most subscription plans are limited to 1 request per second.
Top-tier plans allow up to 10 requests per second.
For higher rate limits, contact our sales team.
Exceeding your rate limit will result in an error response.

### Max results

The maximum number of results returned by each API method is limited up to 60,000 rows.

post.description:
Method `AuditOnePage.scan` allow you to scan one webpage, including js rendering.
This method is deffered. It returns pageId and reportId of audit task.
To get detailed report you shoud make another request with `auditOnePage.getPageAudit` method.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 10 credit per scan.

Rescan project(page), created new audit report.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 10 credit per rescan.

name.description: Name of your project. You can change project name in this method if necessary

post.description:
Stop active page audit.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

Remove project(page) from customer project list for One Page Audit.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

Method `AuditOnePage.getPageAudit` gets last report of project with issues (see `AuditOnePage.getAudit`)

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

Method `AuditOnePage.getAudit` gets results(found issues) of finished audit divided by categories.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

compareReportId.description: `id` of your another report from your project to compare.

post.description:
Method `AuditOnePage.getErrorRows` allows to get detail info about error if error field `hasAdditionRows` is true(See `AuditOnePage.getAudit`).

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

compareReportId.description: `id` of your another report from your project to compare.

mode.description: type of errors (all | new | solved) by default all

post.description:
Method `AuditOnePage.getPagesList` gets list of customer OPA projects(pages) including last report info

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

limit.description: count of returned items in response

post.description:
Get report list for given project(page).

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

requestBody.description: Get all reports for OPA project(page)

limit.description: count of returned items in response

post.description:
Return list of all user project(page) names.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

Returns User Log for given report.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

pageSize.description: Number of results per page in response

created_at.description: User Log message created date in format `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS`

totalCount.description: Total number of User Log messages

post.description:
Method returns basic report information. See `AuditSite.getReportWithoutDetails` to get report categorized by issue type.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

date.description: Date of audit in format `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS`

highCount.description: Total number of high priority issues

mediumCount.description: Total number of medium priority issues

lowCount.description: Total number of low priority issues

informationCount.description: Total number of information priority issues

virusesCount.description: Total number of pages with viruses

progress.description: The progress of the audit expressed as a percentage, where 100 indicates a completed audit

stoped.description:
stopped flag:
0 - audit ended on its own
1 - audit stopped by user

totalCheckedPageCount.description: The total count of scanned URLs, including pages, redirects and images

redirectCount.description: Total number of pages where redirect was found

captchaDetected.description: Indicates the occurrence of a captcha during parsing

post.description:
This method returns the number of errors/issues, categorized by issue type, found in a specific report. It compares the results with the report identified by compareReportId, if applicable.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

compareReportId.description: Another unique identifier for an audit report from the same project to compare

countAll.description: Total number of all found errors/issues

countNew.description: The number of newly found errors or issues, compared to the report identified by compareReportId, if applicable

countFixed.description: The number of errors or issues that have been fixed, compared to the report identified by compareReportId, if applicable

post.description:
This method provides you with a list of elements which contains a specific errors/issues.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

compareReportId.description: Another unique identifier for an audit report from the same project to compare

mode.description:
Error display mode:

Mode | Description
---------|----------
 all | all errors
 new | new errors
solved | fixed errors

limit.description: count of returned items in response

post.description:
This method provides you with a list of subelements which contains a specific errors/issues. Crc can be found in the response of `AuditSite.getErrorElements` method.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

mode.description:
Error display mode:

Mode | Description
---------|----------
 all | all errors
 new | new errors
solved | fixed errors

limit.description: count of returned items in response

post.description:
This method provides statistics grouped by issue categories, allowing you to determine the number of issues related to each specific category present on the site.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

highCount.description: Total number of high priority issues

mediumCount.description: Total number of medium priority issues

lowCount.description: Total number of low priority issues

informationCount.description: Total number of information priority issues

post.description:
This method displays the number of changed errors and information messages for each issue category across all reports within a project. It enables tracking of issue resolution progress over time.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

limit.description: count of returned items in response

count.description: Number of errors or information messages by specific issue category

post.description:
This method provides you with a list of audits carried out by project id. This list can be found in the project Audit summary report.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

limit.description: count of returned items in response

date.description: Date of audit in format `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS`

pagesLimit.description: scan limit, set in project settings

pagesScanned.description: Total number of checked pages (charged limits)

criticalCount.description: Total number of pages with critical issues

nonCriticalCount.description: Total number of pages with non critical issues

virusesCount.description: Total number of pages with viruses

progress.description: The progress of the audit expressed as a percentage, where 100 indicates a completed audit

stoped.description: stopped flag: 0 - audit ended on its own 1 - audit stopped by user

post.description:
This method returns a list of URLs audited during the scan, provided the scan type was configured for assigned URLs (imported or manually entered). It allows verification of the pages scanned by the Audit tool.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

scanType.description: scan type: 2 - scan url list 3 - scan sitemap list

isImported.description: Indicates whether the URL list was imported or entered manually

post.description:
This method provides a list of default configuration values for a project.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

scanSpeed.description: Specifies the scan speed, with possible values ranging from 1 to 30. Every increment of 3 in speed corresponds to one additional thread

autoSpeed.description: Auto speed control, one thread to scan

folderDepth.description: Defines the maximum number of folders allowed in the URL path during the scan

urlDepth.description: Specifies the maximum number of clicks away from the main page of the site during the scan

robotsTxt.description: Verifies compliance with the rules specified in the site's `robots.txt` file

withImages.description: Scans images found on the pages during the audit

dontScanKeywordsBlock.description: The Serpstat robot will exclude pages from crawling if the URL contains any of the specified words. This setting applies when the scan type is set to Sitemap too.

onlyScanKeywordsBlock.description: The Serpstat robot will crawl pages with the following words in the URL. The setting is relevant for the scan type Sitemap too

baseAuthBlock.description: If the site is restricted access, provide access for verification

emails.description: An array of email addresses to which the email messages will be sent.

interval.description: interval to trigger mail in days

enableExportAfterFinish.description: Exports the report automatically after the scan is complete

type.description:
scan type:

1. scan all site
2. scan url list
3. scan sitemap list

tiny_title.description: The minimum number of characters in title

long_title.description: The maximum number of characters in title

tiny_desc.description: The minimum number of characters in the description

long_desc.description: The maximum number of characters in the description

long_url.description: The maximum number of characters allowed for a URL before it triggers the "URL is too long" error

large_image_size.description: The maximum allowed size in KiloBytes for images before an error "Image size is too large" is triggered

large_page_size.description: The maximum allowed size in MegaBytes for page before an error "Page size is too large" is triggered

many_external_links.description: The maximum number of external links allowed on a page before the "Too many external links" error is triggered

post.description:
method saves settings in a suggested project.
 
> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

1. scan all site

importedFilename.description: File name of previously imported URL

post.description:
This method starts an audit session for a specified project and returns a reportId, which serves as the identifier for the report generated as a result of the audit.

<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 1 credit per one successfully scaned page without JS Rendering.
<!-- theme: success -->
> **Credits**: 10 credit per one successfully scaned page with JS Rendering.

This method stops an active audit session and returns the operation result.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

This method generates an exporting file in a summary report.

> **Credits**: This method doesn't spent API credits.

exportType.description:
Type of export file:

Type | Description
---------|----------
 mgxlsx | XLSX file
 mgxlsx_mfiles | Google Sheet 
 puppeter_pdf  | PDF file

requestId.description: The request identifier provided by the client. It will be echoed as field `id` in the response. Example "id":"123"

userAgentId.title: userAgent
userAgentId.description:
An identifier that references a specific user agent:
- **0 - Chrome**  
  *(Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/71.0.3578.80 Safari/537.36)*  
- **1 - Serpstat**  
  *(Serpstatbot)*  
- **2 - Google**  
  *(Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Googlebot/2.1; +http://www.google.com/bot.html))*  
- **3 - Yandex**  
  *(Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; YandexBot/3.0; +http://yandex.com/bots))*  
- **4 - Firefox**  
  *(Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:63.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/63.0)*  
- **5 - IE**  
  *(Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko)*

reportId.title: reportId
reportId.description: The unique identifier for an audit report.

pageId.title: pageId
pageId.description: The unique identifier for an audit page.

categoriesPage.description: Issue Category array. Reffer to detail list of [audit errors](../serpstat-public-api/qq7lrv3zfvhd9-audit-errors)

countAll.description: Total number of all found errors or information messages

countNew.description: Number of new found errors or information messages with report identificated by `compareReportId` if occurs

countFixed.description: Number of fixed errors or information messages in comparison with report identificated by `compareReportId`

hasAdditionRows.description: Has detail info rows, can be get with `AuditOnePage.getErrorRows`

httpAuthLogin.description: Login for Basic HTTP authentication, returns "" if was not given

httpAuthPassword.description: Password for Basic HTTP authentication, returns "" if was not given

auditDate.description: Date of audit in format `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS`

high.description: Total number of high priority issues

medium.description: Total number of medium priority issues

low.description: Total number of low priority issues

information.description: Total number of information priority issues

viruses.description: Total number of pages with viruses

progress.description: Audit progress in percents. 100 for finished audit

size.description: Number of results per page in response

projectId.title: projectId
projectId.description: The unique identifier for an audit site project.

compareReportId.title: compareReportId
compareReportId.description: Another unique identifier for an audit report from the same project to compare

scheduleRepeatId.title: scheduleRepeatId
scheduleRepeatId.description:
Interval id to repeat scan:

0 - manually
1 - daily
2 - every 3 days
3 - weekly
4 - every 2 weeks
5 - monthly

intervalId.title: intervalId
intervalId.description:
Interval id of trigger mailing:

0 - manually
1 - daily
2 - every 3 days
3 - weekly
4 - every 2 weeks
5 - monthly
